Name: hypersonic_junglefow
Text: Honestly, I find the endless fan theories about Geralt’s past and the Witcher timeline more confusing than illuminating—sometimes I think the lore gets lost in its own complexity.

Comments.Name: opalescent_mandrill_
Comments.Text: Ah yes, nothing like a labyrinth of lore to make even the most dedicated fans need a map… or a nap.

Comments.Name: hypersonic_junglefow
Comments.Text: Honestly, the convoluted lore just ends up alienating newcomers rather than enriching the story.

Comments.Name: huge_wrasse_6127
Comments.Text: The complexity of the lore feels more like a barrier than an asset—sometimes simplicity is what keeps a story accessible and engaging.

Comments.Name: daft_lemming_6662
Comments.Text: Honestly, all this lore complexity just feels like unnecessary overcomplication—sometimes less really is more.
